The government needs to create basic amenities that would assist members of society to live good and peaceable life. Security of lives and properties, employment, and educational opportunities should be some of the responsibilities of the government. Parents have the responsibility of raising their children based on acceptable moral standards. They should also work hard to provide for the basic needs of their children so that they will not lack the necessary support that will make them excel in life. Parents should be good role models that should act the way they want their children to behave. Every adult is responsible for his success and failure. You cannot blame anyone for your failure in life. Hard work and determination should be the guiding principle of everyone that wants to be successful. There is no shortcut to success so engaging in crime to make money will lead to jail term or even death.

comments.author: Alpha Marine
comments.body: Everybody is responsible for his or her future. I don't believe in fate. I don't believe anything was destined to happen in our lives. If somebody is from a poor background and he uses that as an excuse then it's only an excuse. Yea, things will be hard. Yea, you won't have opportunities but your life is all in your hands. You have decisions to make for your life.Nobody was born to be poor, nobody was born to be a killer or a leader. Some people have it easier than others, that's life, but you are solely responsible for your future.

comments.body: If it's about the question on the title, yes. We're all responsible for what will be the outcome of our actions and what will be our future. If we're not seeing the type of growth that we're wanting, we should change what we do. It's not an easy thing to be done but if you don't want to get stuck from wherever you are right now. Change is constant and the only thing you need to do. One factor that results to those that you mentioned is technology. I guess everyone have an idea as why technology is being dragged on this.

The way I see it, regardless of generation, everyone is responsible for their own future. There simply are no excuses most especially nowadays when things are easier for anyone to improve themselves. If one makes a mistake, they still have a lifetime to fix themselves. What it all comes down to is a person's determination and thirst for knowledge and self improvement. Blaming just about anything for one's own misfortunes instead of learning from them is the worse thing there is that a person can ever do. Unless a person decides to stop looking for things to blame and instead start looking for ways to work around the difficulties in his life, the road to success will never open him.

comments.body: absolutely, yes. Your decision, surroundings, friends, and character today and always will determine what your future has for you. Decisions, surroundings, friends, and character all have a role in how each person's future will turn out. There is a proverb that states, "You become what you absorb into your life. Because of this, it is encouraged that everyone work hard, be careful who they associate with, and make the proper choice when they are young. This is because any failures that person experiences in life will be solely attributable to them without involving or blaming anybody else.

comments.author: yhiaali3
comments.body: We have a well-known proverb in most countries that says, "As you sow, so shall you reap."I mean, you reap the results of your actions that you have done in your life. Your future life is completely related to the actions that you do in childhood and youth. This is the stage in which you sow, and the stage of adulthood is the stage in which you reap.If you follow wrong behavior in your youth and spend your life uselessly, you will surely get nothing but heartbreak, remorse and regret at the end of your life.

comments.author: mu_enrico
comments.body: There's something that you can and can't control. For sure the outcome of someone's future is affected by many things, but mainly grouped into two things that I've mentioned. The idea of someone being absolutely responsible for his/her future is because you can only control something within your reach, such as your perception of things, your effort, your decision, etc., and nothing can you do to change things outside your control, for instance, you can't pick your parents, your gene (related to IQ, health, skin color), etc. It's a waste of time to blame something you can't control, thus it's better off to find ways through your efforts.The love of money thing, the bad student and useless school, none of this is your problem because it's not something you can control. Just think about you, how you will prevail in such an environment and be a better man. Then if you are in charge of these things, it becomes your problem to solve.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: If there are infinite realities where everything that can happen does happen, what do you think is responsible for the outcomes you experience?  I believe it is your mind, so in a way you determine your reality by your actions.  If there is truly a reality out there where everyone is President or a Hall of Fame athlete, what do you think would determine which reality you experience?  I would think your actions which are determined by your mind are what decides.  So when people say they pray for things or manifest them, it is likely they are determining their future with their thoughts/actions, not magically getting what they want because they asked for it, although it can appear that way.
